levelDescription: It's cold outside. Except for a strange old house in front of you, there isn't much else around. You are surrounded by a dense forest. There is also a small path covered in leaves to the west side of the house.
As you open the door, you stare into a dark room. You start to feel around the wall next to the door and notice a lightswitch.
The porch looks rather old, and the color is almost gone. The windows of the house are all boarded up from the inside and it looks like they are painted in black. The porch is barely holding up.

You are now in the main hall of the house. There isn't much in this room except for three odd doors with three different colors. The windows are painted in black, and some old creepy paintings on the walls are covered in cobwebs. The green door to the west is open.
You find yourself back in the main hall. It looks similar to before, but the red door has opened.
You find yourself back in the main hall. The red door is closed, and the pink door to the east has opened in its place.
You are back at the main hall. A new door has appeared. It has four keyholes, each with a different color...
The green keyhole makes a metallic sound as you turn the key. The red one starts emiiting intense heat, almost as if there is raging fire on the other side.. But it doesn't burn you.
The red keyhole is now cold to the touch. You hear a faint noise. As you put your ear to the pink keyhole, you can make out a babys babble.
As you turned the pink key, the baby noise fades. A liquid now starts dripping out of the blue keyhole. Is it.. tears?

The door closes behind you, leaving you alone in the dark. Suddenly, everything lights up, and you find yourself on the beach. There's a lighthouse right in front of you up the hill, a shipwreck by the coast and what looks to be a shed close to you. Which way do you decide to go?

While making your way up the hill, you encounter a gate blocking your path from going to the lighthouse. The gate appears to be very sturdy despite looking to be well over a hundred years old. There are also spikes at the top that makes it impossible to climb over it.
You stand outside the lighthouse.
You enter the lighthouse. There's stairs leading up to the top floor.
You take the stairs to the top floor of the lighthouse. The room is filled with a mysterious aura that makes you feel joyful. There's a green key hanging on the wall.
You stand outside the shed. There seems to be no one inside when looking through the window, so it's probably safe to enter...
You enter the shed. It's filled with what looks to be a bunch of old fishing gear. There's an old-fashioned oil lamp thats hanging on the wall. There seems to be stairs leading down to the basement.
You find yourself in the basement of the shed. There is nothing but a bunch of old junk. Your vision is very limited due to the darkness. There might be a way to light up the room...
You see a shipwreck in the distance, it is probably worth checking out.
You find yourself inside the rustic shipwreck. The boat seems to be very old. The captains cabin seems to be up ahead.
You are currently inside the captains cabin. There's a framed family photograph on the wall of what looks to be of the family of the ship's owner. There's a desk with torn pages on it.

You enter a big room with two red armchairs in front of a fireplace. There are some paintings hanging on the walls. You can feel the heat emitting from the fireplace. The flame is dancing so violently. The fireplace could be useful later on...

An old kitchen, but with some modern modifications. The fridge is old, and it doesn't seem to work anymore. There is a photograph taped to the fridge. There are some stairs leading down to the basement.

It's cold in the basement. There is not a lot of things down here, just some old furniture and some boxes filled with mementos. Most of it seems to be covered by a red cloth to protect them from getting all dusty, except a ladder which is leaning against the wall. This might be useful later. There are some stairs leading up to the kitchen.

A small hall with a clothing rack on the side and a small red carpet with the letter 'A' on it. There are also some pictures on the wall. However, you can't seem to see any faces in the pictures. All of the faces are blurry. Beneath the pictures is a small table with a bowl, the bowl contains car keys. There are some stairs leading up to the upper floor.

It's so quiet up here. There is only one door (which you guess is the bedroom), an attic with an open hatch and a window, which is painted black. The sunlight somehow still makes its way through. There are some stairs leading down to the hall.

The attic is very dark, but the sunbeams from the windows make it much easier to distinguish what hides behind the dark. There are some boxes with the label 'memories'. In the middle of the attic is a grey key.

It looks like a regular bedroom. The walls are red, a shelf filled with books, photos, a tiny leather boot and a box full of old watches. There is a big round window in the room, which is painted black. In the center of the bedroom, there is a canvas which is painted red.
This is a room with a pink crib in it. It looks misplaced. Nothing else in here. The emptiness is too much. Best to move on...

This room is filled with baby things. The walls have painted unicorns, and the shelves are filled with toys. A worn doll catches your eye. Is it waving or are you losing your mind? The only thing missing is the crib...

The room bathes in a glowing red light. A silver toy car lies upside down in the middle of the room. A dark stain slowly grows from under it. You hear a high-pitched screaming noise in the back of your head... your head starts to throb and your heart beats a thousand beats a minute... you have to get out. Now.

A nursing room... and a changing table. A funky smell envelopes you as you enter. The smell is sweet, but somewhat earthy... strange. A moldy pacifier lying on the changing table is caught in a bleak ray of sunlight.

A study. A nice, comfy chair, rows upon rows of books on the shelves and a decanter filled with a golden liquid  standing besides a used glass... Dust everywhere. A dirty blanket is wrapped around the back of the chair... it looks somehow familiar.

This room is a mess. Broken bottles and thrashed books. A nursery rhyme is scribbled on the walls... A notebook lying on the floor stands out from the rest. It's titled Nursery Rhyme and has the same rhyme in it as is scribbled on the wall...
You enter a dark room, and you hear a faint sobbing. The only light there is, is shining through the bottom of a door to your left. In front of you is a hallway leading seemingly into nothingness.
In the room, there is a desk with a wooden chair and a torch hanging on the wall. It seems the torch isn't bolted to the wall. You might be able to pick it up.
As you enter the hallway, you see there's corridors to the left, right and in front of you. The sobbing becomes ever so clearer.
As you hold your torch up, you catch a glimpse of something shining in front of you down the corridor but the faint sobbing subsides.
On the floor, there is a rusty key in front of your feet.
As you hold your torch up you catch a glimpse of something shining to the left of you down the corridor.
While the sobbing increases, you get a feeling that you're missing something.
As you walk forwards the sobbing increases. In front of you is a closed metal gate, to your right is a damp room.
In the room there's a keyhole on the opposite side of the gate.
The sobbing increases, you can see a corridor on your left.
The sobbing becomes significantly louder, you can make out a figure in front of you sitting on the floor.

On the floor, there's a dark-haired girl sitting on the ground, with her head in her hands covering her face. As you walk up and lay your hand on her shoulder, she crumbles into ash. You jump back, shook by the event. In the ash there's a blue key. Could this be the final piece of the puzzle?

A dark room with a bright beam of light shining down on a mirror. As you approach it, tears starts to flow down your face as you realize who you are. It feels like you are drowning. You can see the real you, what you have become, and you remember everything. Your sister, raven hair and blue eyes. You shared a bond only twins can understand...

...She was so full of joy just like her daughter, the orphaned daughter. It was your fault. Somehow, you have repressed your own memories to make yourself accept the image staring back at you in the mirror.

You remember that day at the beach together with your parents and your sister. It was a day full of joy. The excitement of running around together with your sister around the beach, discovering the scary shed, the old looking shipwreck and the fantastic view from the top of the lighthouse. If only you could travel back to your childhood, back to that joyful day. If only you could remember your sister's face, why is this memory coming back to me now?

This memory is different from before, it seems like it has been a good 15 years from that day at the beach. You are arguing with your sister in the kitchen back at your house. The walls are so red and the flames from the fireplace are so violent. Your sister seems pretty upset with you and you can't seem to reason with her...

...You can feel the rage flowing through your body and your sister suddenly stops talking to you. She walks furiously to the hall, takes the car keys and slams the door behind her. This was the last time you ever saw her. She had black hair...

You remember your lovely niece and all the pink colors in her crib room. The baby looked so fragile while lying in her pink crib and at the same time strong, so full of hope, like nothing could touch her. The baby slowly opened her blue eyes, but she didn't cry. She just stared at me with her blue eyes, it reminded you of your sister. The little baby rose her arm trying to reach you, so you tried to meet her hand with the top of your finger but as you made contact everything disappeared.

You remembered that you woke up in the hospital after the accident and your parents was by your side. They weren't happy, they had this sadness in their eyes. You couldn't see your sister anywhere, so you asked your parents, but they didnt reply...

They gave you a box which contained a pocket watch. Inside the pocket watch was a picture of my niece. You closed the pocket watch and you were filled with endless pain and misery. You didnt argue in the kitchen, You were arguing in the car. You were the driver and you didn't see the car that would forever change your and your sisters lives. Her clock stopped ticking and she left you, and now you are left with nothing but time.
You lost or something? What the hell are you doing here? Get back to the game weirdo!
You've managed to reach the end of the game, thank you for playing!
